description:
Why five stars? Because in what it does, Corner does it excellently. Clean; good prices; solid, consistent, well-prepared food.
The staff cares about the product and service they offer. I have never seen any hint of, "wadda ya want for cheap" attitude here. They look for ways to make one's meal better, and that's hard to do without table service.
From the few less-than-stellar reviews, I'm sure Corner has its bad days like everywhere, but not only have I not experienced them, but I predict the they will take responsibility for problems
author: Richard H.

description:
I came here as per recommendation from a work colleague. The ambiance/decor is nice, with warm wood accents throughout. After ordering at the counter, a number is provided, which you stick to a stand at your table and wait for your order to be fulfilled. For take out orders, the food is delivered at a counter on the side. The restaurant is generally clean, although I noticed it took quite a long time for the table next to mine to be cleaned after the customer left.

I ordered take out the first time and had a sit down breakfast in my second visit. The take out took a long time, in part because the kitchen incorrectly plated it for eat-in; I saw the server sending my breakfast sandwich back into the kitchen; a few minutes later, it came back out wrapped for take out; despite the fact that the server was right there looking at the opening to the kitchen, she ignored it and busied herself with other chores, until she finally decided to bring my order to the take out counter. At the time, I strongly suspected that was my order sitting there, but was not 100% sure, otherwise I would have asked her sooner for my order.

Service during the second visit, when I ate in, was fine. My order was delivered with a smile.

For take out, I had the Anaheim Panini (scrambled eggs, smoked bacon, tomatoes, onions, avocado & cheddar on sourdough); it had good flavor, although the texture was not the most pleasant, probably because of the avocado that makes the sandwich a bit mushy. For eat-in, I ordered the Anaheim Scrambler (scrambled eggs, smoked bacon, tomatoes, green onions, cheddar & avocado served with harvest toast and fresh fruit); it was fine; in my personal opinion, I found the panini version more tasty.

Great convenient location, right on Market Street, close to the Montgomery BART station.
author: Tom S.

description:
Life saver, decent food at that price point.

I picked up my breakfast there and took it back to my room for the remainder of my last trip so that I could better avoid the bums that wander the streets and wander into the restaurants.
author: Ricardo O.

description: Bad customer service! Rude servers. I was seated and waiting for my friend so we could eat together. One server came to me and ask to leave if am not a customer and said I have been sitting too long. I would understand if it was packed and other customers have nowhere to sit. It was so embarrassing and demeaning to be treated that way!
author: Gisella C.

description: This is one of my favorite places to eat when I go to sf and shop around didn't even know this place was here brunch here is delicious and so is there soups
author: Leslie G.

description:
3.5 STARS

So lately, I can't stop eating. Sweets and carby food to be specific. When a talent brought some goodies to work from Corner Bakery, I was super excited. She dropped them off on Tuesday, January 16th around 12 noon.

We got a box of assorted cookies. I believe the flavors were: Chocolate Chip, Monster, Oatmeal Raisin, Sugar, and English Toffee. I ended up having two of the sugar cookies. (Yes, two whole cookies!) They were soft, chewy, and not overly sweet. Just the type of cookie I prefer. Though it was slightly crumbly, so just a touch crunchier than I prefer. However, if there were any left, I would have had an english toffee as well. Yes, the box was for the whole office, so I had to share. At least I was able to have more than one.

One of my coworkers comes here all the time for their food. Their soup in particular. I'd love to come back and try their savory items. I do love a good cup of soup. But for now, their cookies are a nice treat.
author: Elena N.

description: Never thought I would like an cheese egg and bacon sandwich with tomato but the Commuter Croissant was very good    Could have been warmer but I think the tomato cooled it  but still VG
author: Chas P.

description:
I was traveling for work, and this cafe was round the corner.

Trying to recover from my fatty corned beef, I opted for a half sandwich and small soup option. So it was the Chicken Pomodori Panini and Tomato Basil soup. The soup heavily seasoned and excellent, but the best part was the Panini. Sliced chicken, melted cheese and pesto mayo had a great balance in flavors. 

The portions was just right, not too heavy and I was not hungry afterwards. 

After recharging myself with food, I saw there was a table with power plug at each seat, so you can recharge your phone. You need a plug adapter, no USB chargers here.

Turn around time for food was quick, and if you are bored you can watch the game on the large screen TV.
author: Brandon W.

description: So I'm an LA native, so when I found out they had a location in SF, I was thrilled! However, when I picked up my chicken pomodori and broccoli cheddar soup, I noticed the soup wasn't very thick or cheesy, or tasty, it didn't taste like anything at all. It was very bland. :( The panini was good, but I hope they'll improve the quality of their soups. I do look forward to going back again, it does remind me of home after all.
author: Luis G.

description: My office has ordered breakfast from here a few times and their chilled oats is the BEST! Never have I tried chilled oats before, so it did not sound appealing at first. In fact, I was a bit hesitant but I am soooo glad I tried it because it was beyond tasty! Filled with fruits, oats, currants, cranberries and a few other goodies. In addition to their chilled oatmeal, the parfait is just as fabulous. Quick and easy breakfast!
author: Nargis S.

description:
I've been coming to this cafe for years and this is the worst experience ever. I've ordered the Anaheim panini before  and have received a standard sized sandwich cut in half. This time I ordered 2 orders, when the sandwich arrived it was clearly one order cut into 2 slices. I went up to complain to the manager who insisted that it was because they "ran out of the correct bread" and had to give us another kind of bread. Not the case as I have had this order fairly recently and we had the right sized bread. He started pointing to the poster as if this would help his case (no dude, poster showed a full sandwich). 

Later my boyfriend also went up to talk with the manager after seeing how upset I was. He was told by the same guy that the entire company had changed their bread on the panini. When my boyfriend asked when this happened, the manager replied "last week". 

Come on guys, you couldn't even keep your story straight and you tried to bullshit your customers. Never coming again and telling all my friends about this pathetic experience. 

See my photo which I have also posted here for proof.
author: Anna Y.

description: Excellent location near the Palace Hotel - where we stayed - great service, friendly staff - pancakes are delicious - good coffee and clean environment!
author: Margaret B.

description:
When Corner Bakery opened on Market street, I was super excited because I have had great experiences with them. I couldn't remember why I stopped going, so I went there for lunch a couple days ago.

My mac & cheese was good, but I had the oddest Ceasar salad. There was no dressing. it was just lettuce, croutons, and cheese. I checked my bag to see if it came on the side or something, but there was nothing there. What's a ceasar salad without the ceasar? 

I know remember why I stopped going - there was always something missing from my order. Sigh. It's my fault because I didn't check before I left the store, but I shouldn't have to. 

In all likelihood, I'll be back. Back my recommendation to others is to make sure you get what you've ordered. And the food is decent.
author: M M.

description:
We had a business meeting and had both breakfast and lunch from the cafe. The coffee box was great, the croissants were light and buttery and some of us went nuts for the muffins. 

I had actually stopped by the cafe the day before, not knowing most of my meals in SF would be from the cafe. I loved the option of the trio, and ordered three salads. For some reason, two seemed too little but three options seemed like a steal! I had the Asian sesame (loved the light ginger/soy dressing), chicken salad and fruit. 

Service was great too. When I tried to find somewhere to put my dirty dishes away, same promptly came to me and insisted I didn't have to do that. Didn't know, but it was nice.
author: Esther G.

description:
Arrived around 7:30am on a Monday morning, no line to order but there were a few other customers already seated and eating. You order at the register and you're given a number where the waiter will bring your food over to your table. I ordered the Anaheim Panini (scrambled eggs, applewood smoked bacon, tomatoes, green onions, avocado and cheddar cheese on grilled sourdough). Bacon was crispy and not overcooked, good portion of avocado- enjoyed this sandwich and it filled me up.

The price seemed a little expensive for just a sandwich. Maybe if it included a small side of fruit or hash brown it would make it better.

Self-serve coffee was OK, not bitter or lukewarm.

Store itself and the bathrooms are clean. You need a code to use the bathroom. 

What makes this place great is that the high top bar tables have outlets to charge your electronic devices. And their Wi-Fi was strong. All sit-down food establishments should have this as a standard.
author: Mary E.

description: I got the steel cut oats with cranberries, brown sugar and almonds with a small truffle hot chocolate. Food was excellent. Service was good. Some servers are more friendly than others. My order was missing my hot chocolate, but the server was very apologetic and went to make it right away. Definitely recommend over the usual big chain coffee houses (I won't name names ).
author: Shannon B.

description: The servers here don't understand English so if your order is messed up you have to get back in line ....really grinds my gears
author: Kelly A.

description:
There really isn't much I could enlighten you about the Corner Bakery Cafe. Despite its deliberately quaint name, it's part of a chain of nearly 200 fast food-plus outlets across the country, all very studied in its oddly claustrophobic layout to ensure we all have maximum exposure to the calories they sell in mass quantities. They play in the same ballpark as Panera Bread, Specialty's, and Au Bon Pain, meaning it's a grade level above Mickey D's because they offer some table service, which basically means someone comes with your tray and takes your number. There's no genuine interest in finding out if the food meets a customer's satisfaction.

It didn't. I tried the $8.29 California Grille on whole grain harvest bread and supplemented their pre-packaged chips with a Caesar side salad for $1.49 more. The sandwich was a wet mess and overly seasoned to boot. It contained grilled zucchini, marinated artichoke hearts, roasted tomatoes, spinach pesto and provolone cheese (photo: http://bit.ly/1M9SO9s). There was very little flavor enhancement from the grilling, and I kept wondering if the staff even tastes any of the food they must prepare per directions from their corporate headquarters. My guess is no. I would trust the Korean ladies at any of the gazillion delis/mini-marts that actually know how to make a veggie sandwich.

FOOD - 2 stars...not much thought given to the execution here
AMBIANCE - 2.5 stars...focus appears to be on commerce, not comfort
SERVICE - 2 stars...well...
TOTAL - 2 stars...somebody put Corner Bakery in the corner
author: Ed U.

description:
"Express breakfast in the heart of San Francisco."

The Corner Bakery Cafe is a convenient breakfast/cafe spot for the morning warriors on the go. This cafe is located along Market street in a high traffic area. There is ample seating space for large groups and the areas are generally clean. The menu is straight forward with tons of options and service was relatively fast. Short on time and needing a quick breakfast, I decided to order a cinnamon roll and smoked bacon & cheddar panini. The cashier was very personable and helpful. The wait time for my meal order was a mere few minutes which allowed me enough time to take a look around the establishment. This was definitely a chain.  

My order arrived and to my surprise the panini was soggy, oily and lackluster. The egg filling was watery and had no flavor. The cinnamon roll was not fresh and was a bit hard to cut into. This breakfast reminds me of rest stop foods subjected to hours of heat lamps on a rotating display. The pictures look fantastic but the end result was not exactly as depicted. 

My overall first impression, the meal was not as appetizing as the graphics and advertised pictures and I ended throwing most of it away. The saving grace was the nice customer service.
author: Karlo G.

description:
Food here is like all the others in the chain. Decent, coffee always taste like they have reheated bad coffee. The breakfast is OK, but not over the top ... the reason this one got 2 stars is the snotty attitude of the employees. When I ordered rather then a "thank you" it was like we were playing the staring game with my 7 year old ... a smile would have been nice, a pleasant "thank you, enjoy your meal" would have been great ... when I went to find that the coffee was out, something more then "we are aware" would have been greatly appreciated. 



You are in San Fran ... there are great options for anything you want... especially breakfast, coffee and a pleasant attitude. Try elsewhere, I can almost guarantee a better experience.
author: Nombre O.

description:
My husband likes this place I'm so-so about it. It's hard to find a good place for breakfast in San Fran over the weekend, so we went to this place. It's clean, fast service but just want to impressed. The eggs kept falling out of my panini. Small portions for the price. 
San fran is a weekend breakfast nightmare
author: Rita S.

description:
A friend and I came here for a catch up around 3pm last Tuesday.  I had to repeat my order of an iced vanilla latte with almond milk three times.  Every time the cashier looked baffled and I still think my coffee had dairy in it.  Luckily I'm not lactose.  My friend said his coffee was wrong too.  Not like the place was busy and our orders were not complicated like I'm sure Starbucks sees daily.  

And cashiers like that guy are going to get at least $15 an hour in another few years?!  Just pass on this place.
author: Cat C.

description:
Excellent food and exceptional service , 
Outstanding staff with wonderful breakfast and lunch. Give it a try you won't regret ...
author: Giovanni I.

description: Pretty safe, standard sandwich and lunch spot. Similar vibes to Panera bread. The chicken panini was pretty tasty, though a bit oily. Comes with a pickle and chips.
author: Nick B.

description: Ordered online. Went to store, got in line. Told cashier I ordered online. She snarled that I had to pick it up at the other window. I waited at the other window but no one would help me. Ordered online again. Waited at the pickup window. No one would help me. Finally I called out one woman. She said my order wasn't ready - even though she didn't even know my name or what the order was for! I could see it on the counter, and pointed it out. She snarled at me, begrudgingly grabbed it and slammed in on the counter. I asked for a bag, please. She grabbed a bag and crammed it inside. I asked to speak to the manager. Before I could explain why, the manager said, "She didn't understand you." No reason to be rude. Clearly they have some bias against customers.
author: Cub C.

description:
Corner Bakery, or as I call it CB, was a staple for me when I was a SoCal resident.  I used to go to the CB right next to my work to get salads, sandwiches, and baked goods at least once a week.  When I moved back to the Bay and out of CB-territory, I was seriously having CB-withdrawals, especially when I would get all the CB emails reminding me of all the good eats.  

After a few years of relocating (and waiting), CB finally has made its way to the Bay, with a few locations scattered in SF, Peninsula/South Bay, and East Bay. I decided to come to this CB location a few weeks ago for a late dinner bite on a Wednesday evening.  My first impression of CB was that it was pretty dead, which made sense because this CB is in the heart of the SF's FiDi and it was near store closing time.  I'm fairly certain that this place is pretty busy during lunch hours when all the SF office workers take their lunch break.  All of the workers were very nice and friendly. Of note, the bathroom requires a code for entry, probably to prevent random people (who aren't customers) from using it. 

I had the spicy Asian pork sandwich, which is a pretty new item on the CB menu. It was sweet, spicy, and juicy. The presentation was like that of an open faced sandwich, but the taste reminded me of a mix of a pulled pork and banh mi hybrid...sounds and looks like an interesting combination but it was tasty. I've had most of the other CB sandwiches (note, in SoCal), so the quality and taste of the spicy Asian pork sandwich is quite comparable.

Overall, I had a good first time NorCal CB experience. I'll probably be back here if I'm in the area to get my CB fix!
author: Matthew L.

description:
Service: 5 stars 
Food: 3.5 stars

So my rating just about averages the two out. First off, a friend of mine tipped me off about the offer for a free spicy pork sandwich with a bag of chips. Luckily, there's a corner bakery on the way home from work in downtown SF. I decided to hurry over to make it before my reservation, but I made it 10 minutes past. I also realized that I forgot to print out my confirmation. I was so happy when the manager simply took my phone screenshot and wasn't strict that I didn't arrive on time. She was really nice! I also received a free cookie from another offer-- totaling $12 for the whole meal! It was such a wonderful midday surprise. Also one of the workers went to grab me a cup of water, which they didn't have to do. Two thumbs up for the service!

The place is super convenient bc it's right off Montgomery bart and I really didn't have to go very far. It's across the street from Ginto, RadioShack and bunmee. When I got there, there was no line and the cafe was very clean! I was surprised there wasn't a long line considering it's a free meal. I came at a good time I guess. 

As for the food, I think if I were to purchase it without the offer, I would say it's overpriced. The spicy pork was pretty mild but I don't mind bc I usually don't care for things that spicy. The sauce tasted great. The pork wasn't dry at all. The bread would've tasted better toasted but it tasted okay. Overall, I had a great experience and how can I complain about free food?? Thanks, corner bakery. If it weren't too far for me, I would be back more often.
author: Brittany D.

description: Super rude. Ordered online and tried to pickup at the main window. Clerk got huffy and told me I had to pick it up at the end. Next time I went to the window at the end, and they ignored me. So I tried to get the attention of the clerk and she got mad. Told me my order wasn't ready before asking my name - and I could see it on the counter. Asked to speak to the manager but she immediately was confrontational and sided with her employee. Chastised me (!) for not going to the main window. I tried to explain that I had tried that, but she was in the mood for a fight and just didn't want to listen. Hey Corner Bakery: you're food is not good enough to have such attitude.
author: Lake Y.

description:
Looks nice--seating inside and out. Very similar to the Panera Bread style restaurants...but brighter! 

Their pastries, baked goods, etc sure displayed nicely in a glass cabinet.

FOOD:
Tried the tuna salad sandwich--liked that it had fresh vegetables (carrots, cucumber, lettuce, tomatoes)...was not a fan of the weird tuna taste. Quite fishy--pun intended! Looked appetizing, didnt taste so great.

The Siracha Black Bean soup, on the other hand--was scrumptious!!! Tasted wayyyy better than Panera's. Didnt look so appetizing, but taste was amazing!!
author: Tina S.

description:
They were giving away a free half spicy Asian pork sandwich with bakery chips to promote the new sandwich, and I got one with an oatmeal and currant cookie. When I was there, there was no line and we didn't have to wait long for the sandwich.  The only bad thing was that they put the bag of chips on top of the sandwich in the box so the sauce from the sandwich got all over the chips' bag so if you are getting a sandwich and chips to-go, then you should tell them not to put the chips in the box.

The sandwich: the sandwich's bread was very soft.  If you don't eat the sandwich soon, the sauce will make your sandwich very mushy.  Also, the pork was a bit dry, despite the sauce.  The sauce was a tangy kind of bbq sauce.  I wasn't really a fan of the sandwich and would opt to try a different sandwich the next time I'm here.

The chips: the chips were pretty good and crispy.

The cookie: the cookie was a typical oatmeal cookie with a cinnamon flavor and was not the crunchy type.  It was nice and soft.

If you order food to-go, then they'll tell you to wait to the side and when your food is ready, they'll call out your name... We didn't have to wait that long...

Overall score for the food/experience: 3 stars.
author: Gilda W.

description:
Don't even bother with this place. $15 for half a cup of coffee, cold eggs and the most pathetic looking plate of food ever. Got my food just dumped on my table, no condiments, no nothing. Fruit instead of potatoes. My wife's coffee was gone in 2 sips.

Total shambles, avoid.
author: Darren C.

description:
I have only been there once. I got cinnamon swirl to go. Warmed. And it was an excellent choice. I first underestimated this place, cause to be honest, for a bakery their pastry selection is poor. But one bite into the swirl and I was sold!

Why no one thought about this before? I had hot pain au chocolat before. But hot cinnamon swirl is completely another league. It is actually levelling this pastry to a proper dessert treat.

And so my swirl arrived in a plastic microwaveable packaging (well, of course, what I meant by "warmed" was simply putting it in a microwave for 30 seconds... all magic gone with a press of the "Start" button) armed with plastic fork and knife. Which the sheer idea of using at the very beginning was dismissed by my unenlightened mind.

Then I understood everything. The plastic packaging (apart from the need to put it in  a microwave), fork and knife. You can't eat it with your bare hands! It is simply impossible! This thing is too good for such blasphemy! That's why all these forks and knives, packaging that doubles as a plate. It is a royal treat afterall!

I may never feel as anxious as getting eggs and bacon there, which I am sure are doing justice to this place. But another hot cinnamon swirl? But of course!
author: Jakub S.

description: Came here on a rainy day with my family and it wasn't busy at all. I ordered the lunch combo where you pick two. I ordered the pesto pasta and the portion for a small was huge! I almost couldn't finish it. I ordered a chicken sandwich and that was smaller than I expected. This place is very similar to panera bread, but with bigger portions. Food was good. When we came it wasn't too busy so I was confused as to how our order came messed up. My cousin ordered specifically a sandwich with no turkey, but they gave her a sandwich with turkey. Our lunch combos were missing a few items like bread and our utensils didn't come. Some of us ordered soup and pasta.. How were we supposed to eat our food without utensils? I get that it was pouring outside, but it was slow inside. The staff should mess up on orders if it is slow. I was bit annoyed with how our service was, because we had to constantly bug them to bring things over that I didn't bother ordering any pastries. I feel like if you want food similar to panera bread this is your spot, but otherwise I'd avoid this place if possible. Don't think i'll be returning here willingly.
author: Danika P.

description:
I have very fond memories of Corner Bakery Cafe, having gone many times in Washington, DC. It was a great, go-to breakfast place with fantastic service and a great atmosphere.

Unfortunately, that same sort of hospitality doesn't translate to the fast-paced San Francisco environment.

Overall, the food didn't really meet expectations, portion sizes were small, and it just didn't feel all that personable. Sure, the food was alright, but it wasn't amazing. Maybe nostalgia is attributing to that, maybe it's the atmosphere that made the food really good in DC. I just can't find myself having all that great of a time to sit down and enjoy my meal here.

Maybe I'm ordering the wrong things. Maybe if I order the scrambles that really got the job done back in DC, I might see the joy of this place. Unfortunately, for the time being, it's just a happy memory.

I will be back Corner Bakery Cafe, and hopefully next time will be better.

TIP: San Francisco isn't the best for sit-down breakfast. Just grab and go.
author: Brian L.

description:
A coworker was nice enough to buy the office bakery items from here! Lots of goodies but definitely not for me...

I'm definitely interested in their breakfast and lunch items though!
author: Alice X.

description:
Finally a sandwich that isn't greasy.  I usually stay away from their sammies because they either come out burnt or a greasy soppy mess.  Today I ordered a turkey sandwich and it came out wonderful!  I also scored a free pumpkin bundt cake.  That was good but a bit too sweet.

I ordered a truffle mocha and it was pretty good.  At least it wasn't watered down.

Minus one star for sticking the bag of chips in my sammie box.  RIght on top of the sammy.  Do they know chemicals from the bag can leach onto the food?  Ugh just hand the bag of chips to people please.
author: Wendy H.

description: Liked the tuna salad option...used fresh salad ingredients. The tomato soup was great too.
author: Mohammad H.

description:
I went here for first time today for lunch. I was all excited to try the cold oatmeal cereal, but to my dismay certain breakfast items stop at 11 grr.  But they do have the scrambles just no potatoes.  I don't really understand why they only have select items after 11, oh well.  I got the farmers scramble with whole wheat toast.  It wasn't bad, but I am sure nothing was organic and the jam was that sugary, high fructose stuff.  I liked it enough and it is affordable.  It is an order and eat place, but there was plenty of seating so we got a table.  

If you like diner type food then you will like this place, I am just a little more picky.  There are a few other things on the menu I want to try so perhaps my ratings will improve if I like them. People did seem to like this place though.
author: Megan M.

description: It's $2 for unlimited coffee which I refill my travel mug with. But the best part of this place is the customer service! The staff is very hard working and I notice that they all serve, clean and work behind the counter very well. Also good spot for wi-fi and sitting with a laptop. Try to avoid weekends since it gets slammed with tourists.
author: Michelle R.

description: While the Corner Bakery is a "chain", the food in this location is always well prepared and flavorful.  The folks in the restaurant are always in a good mood, always helpful and the service to take an order and deliver the order is always speedy!  I have breakfast frequently here when working in SF and have never been disappointed!
author: George W.

description: Delicious coffee and tea for my husband, the anaheim panini was delicious. Food came fast and there's a nice homey vibe.
author: Jessica M.

description: An exceptionally clean, well-lit, and well-organized cafe in downtown SF. Walk inside, take a seat by the windows, people-watch, and take a break from the hustle and bustle just outside on the sidewalk. The grilled sandwiches are a bit pricey, but definitely a great value for a once/twice weekly lunch or early dinner. I personally recommend the chicken pesto or meatball marinara grilled sandwiches. If you get on the email list, there are also great coupons that make this place well worth it.
author: Maurice R.

description:
I've been here a few times and the food isn't too bad. Every meal I've order came with avocado and they only literally give you a tablespoon size of avocado on the $10 sandwiches. Around the corner you can a cheaper one and it comes with a full half of fresh avocado. I'm not sure why they cheat you on it here. 

They also leave the water running full on in the sink behind the counter. I told the lady there's a water shortage and she looked at the faucet then walked away leaving it running. It was still going 20 minutes later as I walked out. 

This place doesn't seem to care much about anything ...
author: Lou Z.

description: Yay, I was a fan until Friday.  I ordered a BLT sandwich. Took a seat by the window and patiently waited for my meal.  About ten minutes later, a server asked what did I ordered. I said a BLT and he replied with it should be coming.  Well, 15 minutes later, no sandwich!  I got up and went to the counter and ask to speak to a manager.  At that time my BLT was being placed on the pick up counter.  I told the manager, that this was unacceptable and to charge me for the soft drink and to refund the sandwich.  She politely did and apologized. The place wasn't busy so I don't why the delay. I've been coming here for sometime and they are usually, fast and efficient.  Will I be back?  Yes, because I like the food, atmosphere and friendly staff.
author: Hum V.

description: Came here for lunch today. Ordered two sandwiches, with one other customer in the store. My order was on the screen for five minutes, then they cleared it off (probably to cheat their wait time metrics?) when one of the sandwiches had the wrong toppings. Counter staff all walk in the back. My food comes out of the kitchen, I wait ten more minutes as my order (including a salad) sits under a heat lamp. Five minutes later someone cleaning the floor asked what I was waiting for - they had no evidence of my order. When I told them I think my food was sitting under the heatlamp, she ran to the counter and opened all the boxes to pack them with chips and pickles - without washing her hands. I ask for a refund, she rolls her eyes, I oblige with a one star review and a promise never to eat here again.
author: Matthew R.

description: If you want a tasty but processed and probably radioactive broccoli cheese soup that's mostly velveeta, but also kind of comforting, this is your spot.
author: Andrew K.

description:
Most importantly, Staff 5 Stars 
Food 5 stars 
Coffee 5 stars 
Hibiscus lemonade 5 stars  
My go to place any time of the day
author: Jacqueline M.

description:
My new favorite healthy spot in SF!

Pros: Compared to the restaurants around this place, the price is fair. I paid about $12 for it (priced at $10 plus tax and for health tax?) Portions are very good. I was full 3/4s into my salad and I can store so much food into my stomach (and cheeks!) Healthy food choices with calorie count on them (mine was under 600 calories). Salads, pastas, etc. Lots of places to sit. Seats are placed around the place and the line to order is in the center.

Neutral: HEADS UP for FIRST-time eaters at this place. They gave me a card and told me to sit and put the card on a cardholder so the waiter knew where to drop off the food. Very smart system but my friend had to tell me to put it up. The cashier didn't tell me. Not sure if I would have received my food if my friend didn't tell me... 

Cons: uncomfortable chairs. I sat at the table next to the windows and the chairs were too hard for me; good leg space though. They added too many tomatoes into my salad.
author: Jason L.

description: Salads are delicious, good portions and friendly staff. Got my money's worth hunny. Will go back for sure.
author: Kam H.

description:
I ordered a chicken sandwich and the meat was super processed.  Factory farm quality, then frozen then microwaved into a soggy mess.  I was so grossed out, I just threw the sandwich in the trash and moved on.

The physical space is beautiful.  I hope they are able to step up quality, esp in San Francisco where garbage quality meat is not going to fly.  Good luck!
author: Kate R.

description:
Ordered the Anaheim scrambler and the pancakes 
It was ok! 
Pancake was a little salty....don't know if it was from the butter or the pancake itself. 
The side dish of fruit was not good. We were there at 9 am but fruit was not fresh. It was almost spoiled.  Next time maybe I should get the potatoes.
author: Linh L.

description: They have the best bakery treats! Came here today for a few baked goods and they never disappoint. My favorites are the monster cookie (which has m&ms and brownie batter baked into it), the toffee cookie, and the mini bundt cakes. Prices are very reasonable, especially compared to other similar places nearby like Specialties. I plan on coming back again to try their entrees!
author: Jaymie S.

description:
I've given them four times to get it right, they are one for four. 

I've had the chicken caesar salad and the pasta combo with carbonara., twice each.

The caesar salad used mainly iceberg lettuce, which to me means that it's either a training or cost issue.  I don't really care - just don't call it something that it's not. They are selling a salad that is ostensibly fresh, and so the brown edges on the lettuce was not a good sign.

The pasta has been a mixed bag.  It's cooked to the right texture, which is harder than it might seem in a quick-service place.  And it has bacon.  That's where the goodness ends.  

There were three strips of 1/4" thick x 1/2"x2" chicken in a pasta dish that came out right at $10. The protein portion is tiny, and the chicken feels watery, not very different from the precooked Tyson chicken breast that you can buy in Safeway. 

The cream sauce (which, with the bacon - should make this a go-to meal) was watery and pooled on the bottom. The bacon's been hit or miss.  First time was soggy, second time crisp little squares.

Lastly, I have customized my order on two of my four visits.  It's never been right.  Items that I paid for have not been in the bag.  I don't know who the expediter is, but they are not doing their job. I blame myself in a big way, because I've only gotten my meals to go - and other places nearby have a high-enough standard of quality where I don't have to open and check every single thing to be sure it's as I ordered.

At Market Street Corner Bakery Cafe, evidently I do, cause they are so anxious to get you out they shove whatever's in front of them at you without checking for completeness and/or accuracy.

They belong in a mall food court, not on Market St. in San Francisco.
author: Rick C.

description:
I give this place a four star as I have been there many times by now and the reason is their combos and plenty of seatings in downtown plus it is neat and clean. Corner Bakery Cafe is actually at a corner and walking from the market street I never noticed this place until I found it on yelp. I am a social person and I usually have lunch with my friends even on weekdays and finding a place good for groups is tough in downtown. So I was glad to find this place.

I would pick this place only when I need top have a relaxed lunch and chat with my friends on a weekday. Their panini sandwiches are really good and I love  their crispy potato chips (I guess they are home made). Their soups are delicious too and I am not a great fan of their salads. 

Overall, a nice place with nice and polite staff and I am glad to find it.
author: Pratibha S.

description:
So disappointed. We frequent CB back home so we stopped in for a quick bite. After waiting 25 minutes for our food I asked the status. The kid (Atasaki*) didn't say a word but disappeared to the kitchen and had our food 2 minutes later, rudely set it down. A smile and apology would have been nice. From our seats we could see numerous plates of food just sitting on the line. Not sure why nobody seems to run their food. 

There was a young black girl with dreads who was really nice. She should work at a better location.
author: Gary T.

description:
I came here for lunch and I must say that the bakery items look pretty amazing..HOWEVER, I was trying to be healthier and opted out of the baked goods. (Gasp! what was I thinking..)

I ordered the cafe size tossed Chopped Salad. The Cafe Size and the Entree Size aren't really a huge difference...so I got the cafe size and still couldn't finish it.

The chopped salad was mediocre at best. The chicken is served cold on the salad..and the salad lettuce is chopped super fine. (which I guess is appropriate considering it is called a "chopped" salad), but definitely took away from the satisfying full feeling you get from a loaded salad. The bread that they give you is hard and cold as well...much like the bread rolls you are served on airplanes.

Overall not too impressed...but perhaps I'll try their baked goods one of these days for lunch..they are a bakery after all..
author: Jennifer S.

description:
I am not sure why this place has only two stars....obviously it is not gourmet but the prices are fair for the portions and the quality
If you eat your meal here, there are refills for coffee and soft drinks
They have a fair amount of healthy options (salads)
We went there for breakfast; granted the oatmeal my mom ordered was tiny and not tasty at all...but hey, at least it was cheap and I got to fill my tank with caffeine FREE diet coke
that´s a YEY in my book
author: Claudia C.

description:
I think they make the best tuna sandwich I've ever had in my life. They are not stingy with the amount of tuna, the harvest bread is super-thick and seedy/nutty. There are all sorts of added items on it too: tomatoes, cucumbers, shredded carrots, lettuce. Comes with a bag of chips, and a free glass of water, for a total under $10. I am very happy with the quality and value of this.

I've been here several times, and the staff has always been super nice. I like the whacky assortment and positioning of the tables, where you can stand or sit, whatever you feel like. The wood interior is cozy/homey, and it's a place that meets my cleanliness standards.

But the tuna sandwich is where they really excel!! :)
author: Zoe H.

description:
I love Corner Bakery Cafe. I fell in love while in Chicago last summer, and was very excited to find one in SF. I was meeting up with a friend to have lunch and do some work, and we decided to try this place out even though it had such a low rating on Yelp.

The food was standard chain cafe fare (think Panera but not as nice), but the environment was great - not too loud, plenty of outlets, free wifi. We stayed for hours. I would totally come again for an afternoon of work! 

Coffee: I mixed the light, dark and hazelnut roasts the way I always do when it is a self serve coffee station. It tastes great hot but it gets gross when it's cold, so drink up quickly. 

Food: I got the pesto pasta and enjoyed it. The entree portion is way bigger than the cafe portion for only a few more dollars, and it ended up being my dinner as well as my lunch. My friend got the mac and cheese and salad combo. I think the pasta was good but the salad wasn't as fresh as it could have been. 

The cookies were great! I got the monster cookie (m&ms) and my friend got the toffee. There was a hint of gingerbread that really brought flavor to it.

So bottom line, come for the environment and stay for the cookies.
author: Ariana C.

description:
Gas station quality breakfast panini and weak coffee. Should have just continued on to Starbucks.

Never going back again.
author: Richard P.

description: Decent and a great place for a lunch or breakfast if you have time and stay on top of your order. The service is a little slow and they didn't have fresh coffee ready. Some of our dishes were missing pieces and we had to have them go and get the rest. I think this location needs some work but the overall good concept is good and just fine in other places.
author: Jen G.

description: This place is extremely poorly run. I ordered online for pickup during my dinner break and when I got there at the designated time not only was my order not ready, but they informed me they were out of something. It then took 5 minutes for them to figure out what they were out of and what I could get in return. My pickup time was 6:45 and I didn't end up walking out the door with my order until well after 7. Several people who walked in and ordered after I had placed my order were served before me. To make matters worse, once I got back to my office my order was STILL wrong. It seems like they have a really high turnover rate and everyone working there is super new because they were all running around like chickens with their heads cut off. The food is decent but it's not worth it with the bad service. I won't be back.
author: Alie C.

description: If your in the mood for a light euro style breakfast, this is your place.  The breakfast portions are small and the choices are limited with the exception of pastries. The food/flavor is just acceptable, nothing to rave about. The Corner Bakery is just that, a bakery.  Not a restaurant in my opinion.  For a gourmet coffee and a pastries, ok.  For traditional American breakfast, pass.
author: TheStranger 2.

description: Not satisfied. My panini bread felt like they had toasted it 30 minutes before I ordered. So by the time I received it it was not warm at all. The cheese wasn't melted. The sanwhich is very small. The egg was cold. This place is overpriced for what you receive. Coffee was eh. Oh and the sausage inside my panini looked sad.. I don't know how that's possible but they managed to make my sausage look sad.
author: Lia W.

description:
Although I haven't tasted their food yet, I've eaten at a location is Sacramento before, so I'm clear on how satisfying their food can be and I'd expect nothing different. 
   The reason I had to write a review BEFORE I even tasted the food is because due to the service I've already received, I'm already satisfied and SMILING due to the interaction with multiple employees here!
   The counter person was helpful and patient already nd suggested a few good items from the menu, the nice lady cleaning the dining area took the time to make sure where I wanted to sit had been properly reset from the last guests visit, and when my server brought the food to my table, she was as friendly and cordial as I've experienced at restaurants with higher ratings than this place currently has.
   Something positive must be happening from management to enable employees to be happy enough to care about the customers here, and I wanted to recognize that as a customer I totally felt welcomed, comfortable and happy here.
author: No W.

description: Ordered their mac and cheese for lunch. Fifteen minutes later it arrives lukewarm. I find some curly pasta in a watery cheese-lite sauce, with a stale piece of garlic bread. This was $12. I gave the place an extra star because it wasn't crowded and was quiet enough that I could clear my head after office stress. But being quiet and empty can't be good for business at lunchtime in SF.
author: Edna T.

description: Let me preface by saying, I adore Corner Bakery in Southern California. It was probably my fav spot back in the day. In this location I got 2 sandwiches, but the cashier messed up the transaction and had to do it again. Then after 15 mins waiting, they told me they were out of the bread for my sandwich and if they could sub it. Just not a great experience. Also they are expensive sandwiches-- 2 cost me $21. The service is SO slow and they use plastic bulky packaging for every to-go order. You can just wrap the sandwich - we care about the environment in this city. Get with it, yo!
author: Mariam P.

description:
I WALKED OUT!  Yes, I know that you just opened, but to have five people standing idly behind the counter while the one person at the cash register is struggling with an order is just plain annoying!!  No one else is trained on the cash register?!?

I walked out, I had to get to work.  This explains why there were only tourists in the place and no office workers--service is too slow!!
author: C L.

description:
FINALLY!!! I have been waiting for this location to open!!! 

I first had Corner Bakery when I was on a business trip in Irvine. Fell in love with their Panini and Cesar Salad!!

Since this location has open, I've been here 3 times. ( can't help it)

First time I order (what I was craving) Club Panini on sourdough with a side Cesar Salad! So good!!! 

Second time I ordered their Pancakes with a side of bacon. The bacon was yummy and the pancakes were ok (I've had better)

Just went today for my third time (don't judge me) and had A Cesar Salad to go. So good!!!

My favorite thing(s) about this place:

1. Their homemade Lemonade is so damn good!!! 
2. Everyone that works their is friendly
3. Line moves quick and you get your food in a timely fashion


P.S My friend also tried the pancakes and hated them (she didn't the consistency of the pancake) . There was no problem with that because one of the manager came over quick to take her pancakes away and bring some french toast ( which looked very good)

I really like this place. The menu has enough options to keep you coming back for something new. I plan on trying their pasta next!
author: Monique E.

description:
I can only speak of the breakfasts.  The scramblers are good. But they are STINGY STINGY STINGY with the avocado. They give teensy weensy slices of avocado: THREE slices per scrambler and it adds up to 1/32nds of an avocado. Shocking...

Staff barely cracks a smile.
author: Allie C.

description:
It should not take 15 minutes to barely toast a bagel, smear on some cream cheese and put a few little sad pieces of avocado on it. Especially since there were something like 20 employees milling around behind the counter and in the kitchen. I could maybe understand if they were slammed and understaffed. But I was the only one waiting for my food at the pickup window. 
You're better off going a few doors down and ordering something at McDonalds if you would like to get the food you ordered in any kind of reasonable amount of time. The food would probably be better there too, sadly enough.
author: David H.

description:
I went here for lunch one day and it was pretty good, so when my office was having a breakfast to say thanks to our staff, I thought this would be a great place. I went online, (you can't order online, which is very annoying, actually - you have to call them, and sorry to them I know they're new in SF, but their phone people suck at their jobs. They have no idea what is on the menu, let alone asking what something on the menu actually is or how big it is or if things can be substituted. Not even the "manager" could tell me these things without putting me on hold to look at the menu herself) saw "The Big Scrambler" that sounded good for us. We wanted something completely unhealthy - a reward, if you will. Anyway, it says that it serves 8-10 people with an amass of scrambled eggs, either bacon or sausage, and croissants. On the phone, I asked specifically how much a serving was - we are a group of 20 people and some places have small portion sizes, while others have large ones - and was told it would easily serve 8-10. She went on to emphasize how each "Big Scrambler" would be at least two eggs per person, which, according to the serving size she had just told me, would be between 16-20 eggs scrambled. We maybe got 3-4 eggs scrambled with each of the two scramblers we ordered. 
Apparently, the dish should be called "The Big Meat, with some scrambles on the side" because the meat was plentiful - honestly, like 20 pieces of either sausage or bacon, and then a ton of croissants for each dish, too. The HUGE issue I have is with the eggs. I don't know what any of it tasted like, I don't eat any of those things (well, I had a piece of croissant, which was okay - very buttery), so I can't attest to the taste of things, but people said it was good. My complete issue is with what I was told versus what we received. I'm going to try and add photos to show the unproportional amount of eggs to meat and croissant. 

I gave them two stars, they don't really deserve that. But I gave one for the food - which wasn't bad, I'm told - and one for the delivery woman who went back and brought more eggs for us. I hope she didn't get in trouble for that - because that's pretty much the only reason I'll even come back to this place as an individual. We will never order from here at my work again, needless to say. 

Yes, they're new to SF, but portion sizes (and the actual dishes themselves) should have been worked out at other branches and then just continued here. It's bad service all around, except for that one delivery woman.
author: Melissa Y.

description: The food was alright. I had the Applewood smoked bacon Flatbread. The portions are alittle small for the price but it was tasty.
author: Jeremy B.

description: Pleasantly surprised to be treated very nicely by a very friendly staff both times I've been in there.  Very refreshing as this cafe is located in a very touristy location and usually when this is the case the personnel isn't very nice.  They also have excellent paninis and sandwiches.
author: Lars S.

description: I got the chicken pesto sandwich which was pretty good but I have to say the size of the food for 10 bucks is not worth it. Good food but overpriced. Lastly they were not busy and it took about close to 15 min to get my food ready which was my whole break from work lol thanks.
author: Nina M.

description:
I stayed at the Westin over the weekend, and the Corner Bakery Cafe is only a five minute walk from the hotel, so it was pretty convenient. I grabbed an early breakfast around 8.30 am on Saturday, bypassing the busy La Boulange a few doors down.

I got the Anaheim Panini (eggs, bacon, avocado on crispy grilled bread) and was pleasantly surprised by it. Initially, the panini looked small and I was pretty sure I could devour it in less than 10 minutes, but ended up savoring it bite by bite because it was such a good sandwich! I also got a hot chai - that is your usual chai, slightly spicy but a great wake up call. 

Overall, 9 dollars for a sandwich and a drink, which is okay for SF. I'll head back to corner bakery cafe if I want something quick or on the go, but it's not really a place you will hang out!
author: Julia N.

description:
I have only tried this place for breakfast items - panini breakfast sandwich and scrambler.   The food is decent (not terrible and not fantastic) and the price is reasonable for its location.  Breakfast cost about $8/$9 including toast and a side of potatoes or fruit.  A plus, you can substitute egg whites at no extra cost.  I would come back for breakfast.  
The service is great - the people working here are really nice and helpful.  The place is clean, you can sit and relax while enjoying your food and free wifi.
author: Christina C.

description:
Dude, cmon. It's $6 for a bowl of oatmeal.  You know, they feed oatmeal to horses right? You know what else they feed horses?  "HaaAAaay!"

I go here for bfast when i need to change it up from Uno Dos's bfast burrito.  The bfast panini's are slathered in butter and stuffed with eggs and bakey. I usually tack on oatmeal for a dollar more. yeah, im a sellout.

that about it. oh wait, theres more - "HaaAAay!"
author: Priyan P.

description: I went here for the first time ever because I got a free coupon for the asian sandwhich. I always walked by but I never expected it to be so big inside. They had many tables and the menu looked great. The sandwhich it self was awesome. I honestly thought it wasn't going to be that good but when I ate it I ate it within like ten minutes! For sure I know I'll be going soon again. The people there were pretty nice but when I asked for the bathroom code, the guy lashed asking if I was a customer. I guess that's what being at downtown makes you become.
author: Sul L.

description:
Ordered a chicken caborna today and it was amazing. Deoriea took my order and he's  always sweet and kind asking me how was my day and marlissa gave me my food quickly.

Even with improvements I didn't think I'd have a stronger opinion after my last visits. Thank you cb.
author: Raine L.

description: I love the food here. Their mac and cheese is so delicious!! And the spinach sweet crisp salad is the perfect balance with the  sweet bread inside the fresh greens. And I love that you can buy a bag of the sweet crisps to go!! It makes me crave this place just for that!! However if the staff at this location are rude and they are just very "drowsy". They are down and dragging and always seems to just hate being at work. I have never seen a smile out of the dozen or so times I have came. There is nothing bright or cheerful about this location or team. As much as I love the food the staff makes me dread coming here.
author: Rindi C.

description:
I was invited to the pre-opening day practice party, and I wasn't sure what to expect. Well next time I know to expect delicious Panini, because that's what I got today.  I always look for the veggie option, and there was at least one hot and one cold veggie sandwich. The flavors were great, and the pesto was nice and mellow. Came with some chips.

I definitely need to go back for the good looking Mac and Cheese.
author: Neil R.

description: Great place for breakfast. I am a veggie and love to order farmer's scrambler and the awesome cappuccino. Very conveniently located too, right at the intersection of market and 3rd.
author: Abhishek S.

description: I have been looking for a cafe that kind of has it all: soups, salads, sandwiches.  This place has that and even more. They have so many options for those things, and paninis and pastas. You can order ahead and beat the lunch rush.  The first time I went I got the panini/salad combo and got the meatball panini which was delicious! This time around I got the pasta/salad combo because I had to try their Mac and cheese. Not only was it fantastic, but they gave me a TON of pasta.  I thought it was going to be a tiny thing of pasta and a large salad but it was the other way around.  You get a lot of food for your money, the food is great, and it's in the perfect part of town to grab lunch without going too far from work. Can't wait to eat again!
author: Kristen T.

description: The panini was not a panini at all, just a a day old stale white bread. Very oily. Coffee wasn't good either...
author: Omer Y.

description: This place is amazing! Me and my husbands absolute favorite. We make it a point to come here once a week, and it's great because the quality and price of the food is AMAZING!!! Definitely satisfies my preggo cravings :)
author: Keyla C.

description: Just grabbed lunch from this place, and could not be more unsatisfied. I got a turkey club which was essentially a bacon and cheese sandwich with a piece of turkey and one tomato. I'm not one to write a review, but that is the biggest let down ever. I wasnt asking for something complex, but I guess it was a tall order for the kitchen staff today. Would really love if they would credit me back the $12 dollars I spent on this sorry excuse for a club sandwich. This was the nail in the coffin for me as there are dozens of better places to eat in the area. I would have had a better meal at McDonalds.
author: Ryan T.

description: This place doesn't even deserve a star but one is the lowest number. I ordered a breakfast panini with my friend and I had waited 30 minutes after she got her food before I asked about my order. We had already waited 15 minutes for her to get her sandwich. When I confronted the register about where my food was, the waitress proceeded to say "yeahhhh we're really busy and kind of forgot about it and pushed it off." You don't say that to your customers. She then said "we could refund you if you don't want it anymore." I'm hungry and anywhere else would take even longer. She didn't even apologize for the horrible service or the fact that the staff is inadequate in prepping food for their customers. I waited another 15 minutes before confronting them again, so I literally waited another hour and still didn't get my order. It took them another 15 minutes before I even got my order. A grilled sandwich with scrambled eggs does not take 1.5 hours to make. When I got my sandwich my panini was no longer crispy on the outside and it was completely soggy. Upon picking up my sandwich it was literally leaking everywhere and dripping all over the place. This place's food is mediocre and their staff and service is subpar. I definitely won't be coming here again.
author: Victoria C.

description: This is a great little corner eatery for breakfast or lunch when you need something to eat on the go only half a block from the Palace Hotel. The service was snappy, the food was consistently good and prices were very reasonable! And don't let the name "bakery" fool you. They had a great full breakfast selection, good lunches and we never made it there for dinner so we don't know what their dinner selection might've been like. We ate there almost every day this last week in San Francisco. Highly recommend it.
author: David M.

description: Never had the rudest service I have ever had in a cafe! Tiffany J would not answer my question just the rudest degrading stare I have ever seen with attitude. I was made to feel like scum when asking a simple question about the bread type as I had never been here before.  She made me feel stupid and I will never go back again here.
author: Kristina S.

description: I have come here only for breakfast. At first this place was amazing. Now is horrible. Pancakes burn or hard and eggs cold bacon not crispy and cold as well. I have had to return them because pancakes been to hard or burn. PANCAKES SHOULD NOT BE HARD. When I do returned them the woman looks mad that I'm returning them. Sometimes the food is like if they just had it sitting there for a long time. They also change sizes one they there small and next day there a decent size. This place was good wish they would get it together!
author: Gordon N Juana W.

description: My go to coffee spot every morning! By now everyone knows me and they treat me beyond amazing... This is the reason why i do go there vs Starbucks-employees here care about their customers. Marissa, Alexa and Gerard are amazinggggg!! Thank you for always taking such wonderful care of me :) My special Caffe Ole is the best! The place is always full of happy customers, food smells great, the place is very clean in the best location!
author: Mia M.

description:
Don't order salads. I've tried their Southwestern - lettuce was turning, looked and tasted like salsa was dumped on it. I tried a side caesar in a combo - old looking lettuce and no dressing. 

Sandwiches and soup are good. I had the Chicken Pomodoro panini - it was good, albeit a little oily for me. Turkey on Pretzel Roll was really hard. I guess I was expecting a soft pretzel. 

Lemon Chicken Orzo soup is great. 

Specialties is better for the same $. 

Per another review, my online order was sitting out all packed up. They didn't pack it when I arrived. I requested a text alert which never came.
author: Blaire P.

description: Delicious and fairly priced food. Hard to beat the quality for the price. Also, their coffee is always amazing.
author: David G.

description: The salads are super disappointing. I had the chicken Caesar which, much like many of the other people who've ordered it, was withering ice berg. I was immediately reminded of the lettuce they toss on Big Macs. And again like other patrons, I had no dressing. The chicken was really salty. Also, my colleague's sandwich order was forgotten and all he got to compensate for that extra waiting time was a brown paper bag, which I suppose is worth 10 cents in this city.
author: Virginia T.

description: Went here today with my mom and brother for the first time and had a delicious turkey sandwich with avocado, lettuce, bacon, and mayo. Very filling, very delicious. The restaurant has a cute interior with nice music and atmosphere. Highly encourage anyone to come here for a good sandwich or salad!
author: Tim S.

description: Right now the cons outweigh the pros. The service is mind numbingly slow. They ran out of cups for soda and it took forever for her to figure out to just give me a coffee cup. They charge almost $3 for fountain drinks. That is pretty steep. The order took awhile to come out and when it finally did, they forgot to give me my baked goods. She went to grab it and that took forever too. I witnessed one of the workers touch his hair and beard and then pack a take out order. They also charge the healthy San Francisco tax. The best part is the food. The sandwich was good but not enough for me to want to revisit.
author: Sophia C.

description: Bought a coffee and scrambler. Went to fill up coffee and there was no half & half. I had to ask someone to fill it up which eventually happened. After 20 minutes of waiting...still no food. I left without food and $10 less in my pocket as I didn't want to make a scene. Got to work 10 minute late with no food starving.
author: Bradley S.

description: I took my mother here for her birthday brunch, and we both absolutely loved it. Immaculate area and food to die for. Wilson at the front cash register was exceptionally kind and professional. He even ook the time to give me great recommendations which ended up being perfect. This place had fantastic customer service, and we waited no time at all for the food. Highly recommended.
author: Melissa H.

description: Food is always fast, service is always friendly and fast! I come here at least once a week for lunch. Highly recommended if you're looking for tasty food in the downtown area. Get the Kale Caesar Salad!
author: Jordan A.

description: Their breakfast is 1 star in my book. The buttermilk pancakes are yucky, soggy and bitter and not fluffy at all.  The eggs are not fresh but made from some sort of substitute. I give this place 3 stars because hey redeem themselves with lunch and bakery items.
author: Hilary C.

description: This is definitely one of my favourite places for lunch. I'm usually not a fan of salads but for whatever reason, I do love their take on it. I do usually try to go with a combination meal of half a sandwich and their Tomato Basil soup. Everything I've had from here has been tasty and the service has been swift.
author: Shauna S.

description: New lunch spot with a variety of sandwiches. Work catered sandwiches from here and it was a nice addition to the usual rotation. I tried a roasted veggie sandwich and a tomato and mixer elks sandwich. It's on par with specialtys
author: Bebe W.

description: Decent selection of brunch items on the menu. This place is small and can get filled quickly during busy hours. I came here on a Saturday morning and it was packed. I ordered scrambled eggs and potatoes and had to wait for about 10 minutes before my order was served. Food tastes good, nothing to rave baout though. The service is friendly and prices are reasonable.
author: Venkata M.

description: Very slow and the order was wrong twice. Manager said employee would not make the Anaheim.
author: Craig T.

description: Nice place to hang. Internet speed is faster then Starbucks. Combination is a good choice :)
author: Yayu C.

description: Food would have been okay if it were served hot. Eggs, toast and bacon were cold.  Cold toast with cold butter is a tough combination. Reasonable prices though.
author: Keith L.

description: Our order took too long, but eventually they came to us and informed us that they made an error that resulted in delay.  The manager immediately apologized and took care of all the charges for the order.  I thought this was appropriate seeing that we waited for 20mins for sandwiches... but most places would not provide that type of follow through where Corner Bakery did and we are grateful for honest service.  Restaurant was clean and plenty places to sit.  Will definitely return.  Food was good!!!
author: Tesh S.

description: One of only a few businesses on this part of Market Street that has a restroom.  McDonald's does not have one and the one at Starbucks was out of service.  Food is good too.
author: Jerry R.

description: HORRIBLE SERVICE! I walked in at lunch time. No wait so I walked right up to the counter. The cashier didn't know what to do so she directed me to another order taker. # 2 order taker got my order wrong and didn't know how to cancel the incorrect order. My meal came with a choice of chips or carrots but she didn't ask me what my choice was. She automatically gave me chips.  I asked her if it would be too much trouble to change it to carrots. She said "no problem." Guess what? My order arrives and I get chips and NOT carrots. I understand this is a new place but what the heck, management needs to train better or hire better employees! Overall the food was good but the horrible service will keep me from coming back.
author: A W.

description: I had a very poor experience today with an employee named Tiffany. The food was great but she had a very bad attitude and I could tell she did not want to be there. Part of working with people means being kind and she wasn't.
author: Iesha Y.

description: Great food and cakes...can't wait to go back. The cakes were fresh. Employees were nice. I love the atmosphere of the restaurant. The amount of food given to you matches the cost.
author: Janine C.

description: I went to get breakfast on my way in this morning, as I walk past this store every morning!  I ordered 3 cinnamon rolls, and a commuter croissant TO GO.  A 20 minute wait for a cold croissant to go that barely had any ingredients?  Really?  People that had ordered after me, that were eating there were enjoying their breakfast before I had even received mine.  At this point McD's is more appealing for breakfast, and not a 20 minute wait!
author: Misty A.

description: The salad I got today was sub-par.  It had about an ounce of chicken (on a large salad), they forgot the apple slices that were one of the ingredients, and some of the lettuce was wilted from getting too cold in the fridge. The staff was really friendly, but I won't be eating here again.
author: Jill V.

description: Fine coffee shop. Reminds me of a Panera Bread. Generic coffee, pastry, salad, sandwich combos. A plus that they have outlets at their tables for charging all your electronic devices!
author: Owl R.

description:
Was very excited that a corner bakery opened in the city and so close to my work. I went last weekend and did not have to wait to order. My friend and I order identical meals, yet the order was still entered incorrectly. 2 Anaheim scramble became 1 scramble and an oatmeal??? The order taker was very apologetic and ofer to comp the second order and a manger gave me a credit. We waited 30 mins for our order and only 1 scramble came. I went to inquire about the order and it led to the order taker complaining that her request to dbl the order was not followed, she came back and said they were making it and it would be a couple more minutes. 20 minutes later still no food was brought to our table. I then stood in line with other customers who were complaining about food delays, orders being incorrect demanding a refund. After 20 more mins I finally received my order. At this point I requested for the food to be take out and the manger ofer a refund, which she comped with the exception of my ice tea.
This location opened fairly recently but to have an order entered wrong, then made wrong, then take 60+ min to be corrected, is unacceptable. I will have to wait for a couple more months before I give this location another try.
author: Maggie Y.
